basics.name: Mark Tripoli
basics.summary: Engineering Lead and Manager with 9+ years scaling teams and delivering secure, distributed platforms—from early-stage startups to large tech firms. Architected and led development of IL5/IL6 compliant systems and developer platforms, achieving >50% build-time reductions, FedRAMP readiness, and high-user SLA compliance.

work.name: Picogrid
work.summary: Lead engineering and technical direction for Legion—the modular data integration layer connecting sensors, third-party C2s, and analytics across defense and commercial environments. Architected integrations, pipelines, and a FedRAMP/IL5–IL6-aligned SDLC that enabled classified deployments and unlocked interoperability with partner systems. Partner closely with field and BD to translate mission needs into product vision and roadmap, shipping self-serve integrations that drive revenue and accelerate adoption. Built the engineering organization from seed stage by creating hiring pipelines, designing onboarding frameworks, and mentoring engineers, while instilling a culture of high performance, technical rigor, and mission focus.
highlights: Created and communicated a unifying technical vision for Legion; credited with >$15M in new contracts, including a $9.3M award.
Scaled engineering org from 4 → 15 across software, solutions, and security engineering.
Established secure SDLC practices aligned with FedRAMP, IL5/IL6, and NIST 800-53/171.
Partnered with BD to translate DoD field requirements into roadmap priorities (e.g., TAK Server-as-a-Service, ATAK plugins).
Built self-service integration framework for rapid onboarding of integrations.
Directed FedRAMP SSP & continuous monitoring compliance workstreams.

work.name: HubSpot
work.summary: Led the technical vision for HubSpot’s Developer Platform, partnering with PMs and UX to shape roadmap and developer experience for both internal teams and external app developers. Architected a distributed build and deploy orchestration system and incremental caching layer that cut build times 50–80%, directly accelerating product iteration. Introduced platform primitives—including schema validation at scale and safer rollout mechanisms—adopted across product groups, unlocking more reliable integrations and stickier customers. Guided a team of 3–6 engineers while enabling a stronger app ecosystem and custom-code pipelines that deepened developer adoption.
highlights: Defined and drove Developer Platform technical vision aligned with company strategy.
Built distributed build & deploy orchestration platform (Java, Vitess, Kafka, SQS, ZooKeeper), reducing build times 50–80%.
Designed proprietary caching mechanism for incremental builds, saving thousands of developer hours annually.
Created JSON schema validation service (S3 + CloudFront) serving 5M+ daily requests.
Mentored engineers; supported multiple promotions and intern conversions.

work.name: HubSpot
work.summary: Delivered the observability and logging backbone for Private Applications, designing a high-throughput, low-latency pipeline that processed 3–6M daily requests at a 99.99% SLA. Partnered with platform and product teams to onboard services and establish actionable SLOs.
highlights: Built a custom logging system (Java, Kafka, Vitess, HBase) handling 3–6M daily requests at 99.99% SLA.

work.name: Ghillied Up
work.summary: Co-founded and built a privacy-first, anonymous discussion platform for veterans and active-duty service members. Shipped cross-platform mobile apps (iOS/Android) and a secure backend on AWS, implementing safety features and moderation to foster candid, supportive conversations.
highlights: Co-founded platform for veterans and active military to discuss taboo topics safely.
Developed cross-platform mobile app (React Native, Expo) and backend (NestJS) deployed to AWS and app stores.

work.name: Comcast
work.summary: Modernized Comcast Test Labs operations by building internal platforms that unified asset tracking and streamlined audits across data centers. Led development of a React Native audit app and supporting services that reduced inventory verification from ~1 month to 1–2 days and improved data quality.
highlights: Built asset management platform for Test Labs improving datacenter tracking.
Led React Native audit app development, reducing inventory audit time from 1 month to 1–2 days.

work.name: Amtrak
work.summary: Built and supported mission-critical applications that keep Amtrak operations running safely and on time. Worked across legacy HP NonStop and modern stacks to deliver features, harden reliability, and support 24/7 operations in a regulated environment.

work.name: Amtrak
work.summary: Directed safe, efficient train movements across the Philadelphia–Harrisburg corridor and the Philadelphia–Washington segment. Supervised Train Directors and Block Operators and made real-time decisions to keep trains moving and passengers on time.
highlights: Led territory operations, coordinating Train Directors and Block Operators to balance safety and throughput.
Maintained accurate movement records and operating orders; communicated changes to crews.
Mitigated incidents and delays with field crews, maintenance, and adjacent dispatch desks.

work.name: Amtrak
work.summary: Coordinated station and interlocking movements on the Philadelphia–Harrisburg line, working with the Train Dispatcher to protect safety and on‑time performance in a 24/7 environment.
highlights: Routed trains and track equipment at towers/interlockings; flagged risks early to dispatch.
Kept precise movement logs and operating orders.
Relayed field conditions impacting safety and on‑time performance; coordinated with crews and maintenance to reduce delays.

work.name: United States Marine Corps
work.summary: CBRN Defense Specialist responsible for force readiness, training, and incident response; promoted to Corporal (E-4). Led small teams, maintained equipment and protocols, and coordinated with base and joint units to ensure compliance and safety.
